speaker: AUSBURY
line: All in favour?

speaker: DEBORAH
line: Aye.

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: Aye.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: All right.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: Starting Monday, the track around the athletic field will be Any other items before we call it a night?

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: Yeah, um, I got wind that for the spring drama productions, Howard Roberts intends to put on Jesus Christ Superstar .

speaker: AUSBURY
line: You know how he is... Howard's just trying to do things the kids like.

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: My point exactly.

speaker: DEBORAH
line: Um... I don't think that play is appropriate for this high school.

speaker: VITARIS
line: If he wants to be young, I have no problems with "Grease", or "Annie", or...

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: Doesn't "Grease" have the "F" word?

speaker: AUSBURY
line: Look, I'll talk to Howard. OK, let's adjourn till next week. Deborah, why don't you lead us in a prayer?

speaker: VITARIS
line: Jim -- the game is on.

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: It'll only take a minute. We've been... letting it slip.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: Paul, why don't you get the door. Vitaris gets up, camera tracks him to the door then is "shut out" by him. Faint light is visible around door edges.

speaker: ALL
line: In the name of the Lords of Darkness, rulers of the Earth, kings of the Underworld, I command the forces of darkness to bestow their infernal power upon me.

speaker: DEBORAH
line: Sein ist die Hand die verletzt

speaker: OTHERS
line: Sein ist die Hand die verletzt.

speaker: CAPTION
line: HIS IS THE HAND THAT WOUNDS!

speaker: DEBORAH
line: Sein ist der Ort genannt Hölle.

speaker: OTHERS
line: Sein ist der Ort genannt Hölle.

speaker: CAPTION
line: HIS IS THE PLACE CALLED HELL.

speaker: DEBORAH
line: May the black powers of our forefathers make us strong.

speaker: ALL
line: Hail. Hail the Lords of Darkness.

speaker: KATE
line: How much further? The boys answer simultaneously

speaker: JERRY
line: Up there a ways.

speaker: DAVE
line: Not far.

speaker: JERRY
line: I heard the altar is a hollowed stump, just up here. OK, when they get freaked, you get Kate, I take Andrea. Those mittens are giving me a Gingrich.

speaker: DAVE
line: OK. I need a personal object from everyone. All right. Now Andrea, you gotta stand over here and face Jerry... Like this.... Closer.

speaker: ANDREA
line: Why like this?

speaker: DAVE
line: Well that's so... er... so we're calling the spirits up of every direction. OK now Kate, you gotta stand here and face me.

speaker: KATE
line: Do you really think someone used this place for black magic? Or is it just a rumour?

speaker: JERRY
line: C'mon Dave!

speaker: DAVE
line: Sshh! In the name of the Lords of Darkness, rulers of the Earth, kings of the Underworld, rise, rise to this place. Ah... Azazal. Know ye all who dwell in the light of professed righteousness that the others who know the keys and the angels have opened the gate. A sound like groaning voices fills the air; Dave is startled, Kate looks scared. Andrea is scared -- she jumps to hug jerry for protection. Jerry simply grins. Kate and Dave are very uneasy, looking around. running around her feet. The others are obviously scared now. Still screaming, andrea runs off into the forest.

speaker: JERRY
line: Forget this! Andrea! Kate is turning to follow them. Dave throws something at the rats which bursts into flame as it hits the ground. He turns and they run after the others. We see Andrea, sobbing, upset, running, frantically reciting a prayer of some sort. She is practically hysterical.

speaker: ANDREA
line: ....believe in Jesus Holy Mary Mother of God pray for us sinners now and in the hour of our deaths...

speaker: JERRY
line: Andrea! Wait! He has almost caught her up when a line of flame appears suddenly on the ground. He stumbles and falls to his knees in front of it, blinded by the light. He gets to his feet, shielding his face. A groan-like, animalistic sound is heard. He turns and a thin, bony, cadaverous hand seizes his throat and lifts him up... Up... He is choking.

speaker: OAKES
line: A hunter found him early this morning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Couldn't have been dead for more than 12 hours. She straightens up. During the following we see that she and Mulder are standing over what is obviously a body under the tarp. Sheriff John Oakes is standing on the other side of the body, while uniformed police are searching the area in the background. Everyone carries umbrellas. Throughout the discussion Oakes, a worried-looking man in around his early forties, has an air of "I know this sounds crazy but" about him -- he is well shook up, nervous, but serious in his suggestions.

speaker: OAKES
line: They say this arena's used for witches' ceremonies.

speaker: MULDER
line: "They"?

speaker: OAKES
line: Well.. everybody... everybody who lives around here knows about the things that go on in this town. They say there are people who control things.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Any evidence to substantiate those rumours, Sheriff Oakes?

speaker: OAKES
line: Well, Agent Scully... look at the body... the eyes and heart have been cut out. Mulder looks on bleakly

speaker: SCULLY
line: Many homicides include victim desecration.

speaker: OAKES
line: I know he and his friends listened to devil music!

speaker: MULDER
line: "The Night Chicago Died"?

speaker: OAKES
line: You know what I mean. Heavy Metal bands that influence kids... Oakes moves to join Mulder, who is walking up to the stump, Scully following.

speaker: MULDER
line: Was Jerry Stevens or his friends ever witnessed participating in witchcraft?

speaker: OAKES
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: More rumours.

speaker: OAKES
line: This stump here is supposed to be the ceremonial altar. What do you think? Mulder moves closer to look at it

speaker: MULDER
line: I think with a few turquoise chips, a picture of John Wayne and three cans of shellac it'd make a pretty nice coffee table.

speaker: OAKES
line: Well you see all that wax? Someone's been lighting candles in there. Under the above, Scully has been examining the bag of bottles Jerry had been carrying. She straightens up, then notices something else, goes over to pick it up. It's the page Dave was holding.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Any idea who Jerry Stevens was with out here?

speaker: OAKES
line: Oh... we assumed he was alone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, most people don't set out to drink two six-packs by themselves. I also found this . It has some purple ink on the the end of a title, "in America", on the top, and underneath some words recognisable from the incantation.)...and the end of the title says "In America". I'm surprised your people overlooked it.

speaker: OAKES
line: I'm sorry, I gotta apologise here. You're... you're right, I admit we're a little...rattled...here. That's why I called the FBI. This may involve a deeper conspiracy. See... I grew up around here. Ever since I was a kid I heard... stories. This is a weird area, it has a strange air that I could chalk up to imagination... till today... I'll have my staff start checking libraries for you, Agent Scully. He walks off. Mulder walks over to Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Better hide your Megadeth albums.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Theories like that are why I can't take him seriously.

speaker: MULDER
line: The homicide did have a ceremonial presentation -- the manner in which the body was displayed...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I got the impression you didn't believe him either.

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't want to incite his already clearly aggravated imagination. But there is a weird feel to this place, maybe there is some truth to those rumours.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think he incited your imagination. I think this case is nothing more than a murderer taking advantage of local folklore. I mean there's nothing odd about - She is cut off as something falls onto her umbrella, knocking it. Other thuds are heard. Cut to shot from above. Frogs are falling heavily onto the pair's umbrellas. Cut back to the agents -- they look bemused, Mulder looking up, shielding his face, Scully ducking, definitely startled. The thudding stops. Cut to shot of the ground -- many frogs hopping around their feet.

speaker: MULDER
line: So... lunch?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, toads just fell from the sky!

speaker: MULDER
line: I guess their parachutes didn't open. You were saying something about this place not feeling "odd"? He walks away. Scully stands still for a moment, then follows him, stepping gingerly over the frogs.

speaker: MLS
line: Mulder is at the loans desk, flicking through a box of library cards. CU on the cards. We see one for Stephen King's of the occult in America". Mulder starts to lift the card out. Back to the MLS; we see Scully walk into the library and join Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The National Weather Service says there are tornadoes in Northern Massachusetts. The wind probably picked up the animals into the storm. . CU LIBRARY CARD -- last borrower "DAVE DURAN".

speaker: MULDER
line: "Witch Hunt: A History of the Occult in America".

speaker: SCULLY
line: Last checked out to a Dave Duran.

speaker: PADDOCK
line: OK people... People, may I have your attention please.

speaker: (MCU MRS PADDOCK
line: A typical plain "old maid" type teacher, floral dress, unflattering hairstyle, glasses on a chain round her neck.) Mr Kingary is off sick today, so I'll be substituting. My name is Mrs Paddock. I'm going to take the roll... She is interrupted by a knock at the door. Dave starts up, hearing and Scully, who step a little way into the room. They can only just be heard.

speaker: SCULLY
line: ...FBI, we'd like to speak with a Dave Duran... Dave, hearing his name, makes a mad dash for the window, clambering over a bench and knocking equipment everywhere as he tries to scramble out head-first. Mulder pelts round after him, catches him as he is half-way through, pulls him back by the legs.

speaker: DAVE
line: Let me go!

speaker: DAVE
line: I'm not into that stuff at all, I swear. Jerry was my best friend. Look, I swear, I've never done anything like that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What made you go to a place you heard was a witches' altar? Dave turns his head, we follow his gaze and see Kate and Andrea standing together in a corner. He looks back to Scully, who is sitting opposite him.

speaker: DAVE
line: We were just trying to get some.

speaker: ANDREA
line: I told you. Scully and Mulder turn to look at them, then back to dave. Mulder is standing next to and looking out of a window which looks out on a hallway.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why did you take the book?

speaker: DAVE
line: Because I don't know a thing about witchcraft, and we wanted to make it sound good... but I never thought...

speaker: SCULLY
line: You never thought what?

speaker: DAVE
line: That it would work.

speaker: MULDER
line: If you didn't kill Jerry Stevens, why did you run away from us in the classroom?

speaker: DAVE
line: I'm scared, man.

speaker: MULDER
line: Of us?

speaker: DAVE
line: Of it. That ceremony! I'm afraid we called up some devil or something. Mcu of Kate and Andrea, eyes downcast, they look scared too. We pan past Dave to see Ausbury, Deborah, Calcagni and Vitaris standing in a close group in the area outside the office, looking in and conferring.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: One of you killed Jerry Stevens. Who? He was displayed according to the rites of Azazal. Who else would know about the ritual? We stopped doing this because--

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: I went out there. We were supposed to have a Mass, no-one else showed, so I left.

speaker: VITARIS
line: It wasn't any of us.

speaker: CALGAGNI
line: Something's here... a presence amongst us. Angry, I can feel it. He stops and looks up as we hear the sound of a door opening. showing Kate, Audrey and finally Dave out of the office. Mulder follows. Ausbury starts forward.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: You're letting them go?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's no evidence to warrant an arrest. He walks toward them, Scully close behind.

speaker: DEBORAH
line: They never leave evidence.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: We heard how Jerry Stevens was killed. An occult ritual.

speaker: VITARIS
line: They've reached into our area from outside.

speaker: MULDER
line: "They" again.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: Those three kids are obviously under occult influence.

speaker: DEBORAH
line: They reach into our children. In music, television, books...

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: They prey on children's innocence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The FBI recently concluded a seven-year study and found little or no evidence of the existence of occult conspiracies.

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: And J. Edgar Hoover never admitted to the existence of the Mafia.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, if the number of murders attributed to occult conspiracies were true, it would mean thousands of people killing tens of thousands of people a year, without evidence, without being exposed... it would be the greatest criminal conspiracy in the history of civilisation. Ausbury turns to his colleagues, then back. He walks towards Mulder and Scully.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: Finally, you people understand what we're up against.

speaker: MULDER
line: Our investigation is ongoing. Mulder reaches to Scully, to draw her away. She goes, but looks back in sheer disbelief at Ausbury. Ausbury looks back at the others.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, this is mass hysteria. And our presence here on a routine homicide only gives validity to their fears of occult murder. Mulder stops drinking, pauses, notices something. CU to shot of water swirling down drain of drinking fountain.

speaker: MULDER
line: The water...

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's wrong with it?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's going down the drain counter-clockwise! Coriolis force in the Northern Hemisphere dictates that it should go down clockwise.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That isn't possible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Something's here, Scully. Something is making these things possible. Scully looks again at the water, puzzled.

speaker: PADDOCK
line: Girls... may I have a word? I heard on the grapevine what happened, and, well, I know how hard it is to talk to adults sometimes, even though you feel like you want to......well, because you're young adults... What I'm trying to say is, if you feel like talking, I'm here to listen, ok? The girls smile wanly.

speaker: ANDREA
line: Thanks Mrs Paddock. Kate murmurs acquiescence.

speaker: PADDOCK
line: Hang in there. The girls turn and leave. Mrs Paddock straightens the papers in her hand. We follow her hand down as she reaches to her desk drawer, which opens to reveal a dissecting tray containing a fresh and bloody human heart and two eyeballs. She places the papers on top and shuts the drawer. We pan up to see her smiling into the distance.

speaker: CAPTION
line: CROWLEY HIGH SCHOOL PSYCHOLOGIST'S OFFICE Scully is at a desk, working at a laptop computer, other staff going about their business around her. Pan past her to the window of Calcagni's office, where we can see Mulder and Calcagni, seated, in conversation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Your records indicate a high incidence of students complaining of depression, headaches, eating disorders...?

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: This is high school. . It's normal for students to display abnormal behaviour.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm assuming you're familiar with the early indications of repressed memory?

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: Just because a student has a headache doesn't mean he's repressing a memory.

speaker: MULDER
line: In your counselling you've found no evidence of past ritual abuse?

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: None. Mulder gets up, walks to the door and opens it, then turns back to Calcagni

speaker: MULDER
line: Would it be possible for me to speak to any of the students who've had chronic complaints?

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: That would be a betrayal of the doctor-patient relationship. Sorry. Mulder looks at him thoughtfully, then leaves, shutting the door behind him. Cut to Mulder coming out of the office, walking round to where Scully is. She continues concentrating on the laptop.

speaker: MULDER
line: For the body of student of complaints, he was pretty quick to dismiss my concerns.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe there's nothing here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, he's hiding something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Take a look at this. I found this on the Internet

speaker: SCULLY READS
line: ) "The discovery yesterday of a mutilated teenaged boy in the forest has police officials distressed about the possibility of a conspiratorial organization of Dark Forces."

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's that pulled from -- the local paper?

speaker: SCULLY
line: "The Jew is known to remove organs and sacrifice teens in their religious ceremonies". It's taken from "Volkischer Beobacter", a Nazi newspaper in 1934. The rumours are the same, but the blanks have been filled in with whoever must be feared or persecuted at the time. In this case, it's occultists. Mulder crouches down by the desk, looks at her seriously.

speaker: MULDER
line: Modern witches, known as Wicca, are a religion. They have a great reverence for all life in Nature, they do not cast harmful spells, they don't worship Satan. Even the Church of Satan has renounced murder and torture. Their influence here wouldn't account for the frogs, or the water draining backwards, or most importantly, the murder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if not witches, then what?

speaker: PADDOCK
line: For your final examination, one-half of your grade will be based on your diagram of a dissected pig embryo. Of course, these are actually hog embryos, belonging to the order of the archeodactyl , or creatures with hooves. Be sure to remove the heart and lungs and draw a diagram of each. Be neat. Extra credit will be given for dissecting the heart. You have until the end of the period. Mcu on Shannon, who is now looking quite ill, twitching a little, looks ready to vomit.

speaker: BOY
line: I'll cut it open... if you do the heart. Shannon nods, can't take her eyes off the hog, closes her eyes as we hear the squelchy sound of it being cut open. Cut to cu of the embryo with its guts showing. Cut back to ecu on Shannon, sweating, her eyes start open, she gasps, makes other noise of distress. Cut to paddock, looking up sharply. Cut back to Shannon, obviously very distressed. Ecu on embryo heart, which beats. Ecu on Shannon, who is gasping as if she cannot breathe. Cu on the embryo, which moves its head from side to side. We hear a squeal which turns into Shannon screaming. Brief shot of other kids in the class, startled, looking round. Back to Shannon, who screams again and again. Cut to Paddock, looking on dispassionately. Back to Shannon whose screams are mixed with hysterical sobs. Back to Paddock, who has a knowing look on her face.

speaker: PADDOCK
line: I've had this happen before. Some kids just have trouble dissecting things. CALCAGNI WALKS OVER TO THEM.

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: Shannon -- I'm trying to reach your father and get him to pick you up.

speaker: SHANNON
line: No! She jerks back. Mulder and Scully, in a corner of the area, notice immediately. Calcagni crouches down in front of her, takes her hands reassuringly.

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: I'm sure he'll be here soon.

speaker: SHANNON
line: No! She wrenches herself away, gets up, runs out of the office. Mulder follows her.

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: Shannon honey, come back!

speaker: PADDOCK
line: Shannon? Shannon!

speaker: MULDER
line: Shannon! You're remembering! Tell me what you're remembering.

speaker: SHANNON
line: You know who my stepdad is, right? Jim Ausbury on the PTC. . All right, well, my Mom, she's a teacher. Well, was a teacher. My real Dad, he uh, he ran away, and my Mom met Jim at some seminar or something... and they um, they got married. My sister and I moved up here when I was about... um, four. She was about two. Anyway...... a, a couple of weeks ago, my class, we took a field trip to what they call the American Stonehenge... and... and.. I remembered when I was four years old, Jim took me in his car near there, and he um... he made me... in the back seat......he told me that if I ever told anybody that he would hurt me... As he touched me, well, I would pretend that I was like, out of my body. Deep in the ocean, down with the fish, in the dark water... Somehow, I don't know, I managed to block out all these things, but... lately it's all been... I'm remembering, you know? The others too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Others? Mulder looks quickly at her, then back to Shannon

speaker: SHANNON
line: ...Yeah... Men and women. They would... come to the house, you know, when my Mom was away? And they would.. uh... take me down to the basement... It was really dark... it was like painted red, with a dirt floor. They would wear these robes, black and red and they would... sing, and they would chant, and then they would tie me and my sister up, these men and women... they would make us... do things. They called me a breeder! They would get me pregnant, and then they would kill the babies......I've had three children, and they're all buried in the cellar. One night, Jim murdered my sister for a sacrifice. She was only eight years old! He told everybody that she died in an accident....Today brought it all back, clear like it happened yesterday... SHE MOVES TOWARD SCULLY, WHO HOLDS HER AS SHE GOES INTO A FRESH BURST OF SOBBING.

speaker: MULDER
line: Imagine... if what she said is true...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why don't we just wait and see what her parents have to say? The car stops, they get out and walk towards the front door. They get about halfway along the path when the door opens and Jim Ausbury hurries out to meet them. Mrs Ausbury is visible behind him. She stays in the doorway, hugging her cardigan to her.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: Where's Shannon? They told me you were bringing her home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She wanted to remain with friends. And... under the circumstances, we thought it best.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: Circumstances? Why wouldn't she want to come home? LIVING ROOM, AUSBURY RESIDENCE Cu Ausbury, clearly very shaken. Mrs Ausbury's sobbing can be heard in the background.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: Someone, or something, has obviously put these things into her mind. He looks at Mulder, who catches Scully's eye and nods silently towards the kitchen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs Ausbury? Er, perhaps you'd like a glass of water. We see Mrs Ausbury, overcome, sobbing quietly. She manages a tiny nod. She is barely audible.

speaker: MRS AUSBURY
line: ...Yes, thank you... Makes visible effort to pull herself together. Mls of room, we see that the ausbury's are sitting side by side on a couch, Scully sitting on a chair opposite them, Mulder standing to one side of Jim Ausbury.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr Ausbury? He motions toward the kitchen. Ausbury looks at his wife in concern, he clearly doesn't want to leave her, but gets up and walks out of shot. Mulder follows. Mrs Ausbury is left hugging herself nervously, still upset but calmer. Scully shifts in her seat.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs Ausbury... your daughter has not accused you of any involvement in these activities. Do you have any idea why Shannon might have said these things?

speaker: MRS AUSBURY
line: Jim and I have been having... marriage problems, lately... we're committed to working them out. Maybe we haven't been... paying enough attention to Shannon. She and I don't... we don't get along. We fight.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have you ever known Shannon to be pregnant?

speaker: MRS AUSBURY
line: Of course not! She's fifteen years old! How can you possibly believe such--

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have you ever had another child?

speaker: MRS AUSBURY
line: A girl. Theresa... She died.

speaker: SCULLY
line: At eight years old?

speaker: MRS AUSBURY
line: Eight weeks. It was crib death. SCULLY SIGHS. Cu glass under tap, overflowing. A hand turns the tap off, pan up to Ausbury's face. Mulder stands behind him, walks closer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you do it? Ausbury turns to look at him, the beginnings of shock and anger on his face. The glass in his hand shatters, the noise startling them both. He drops the remainder of the glass into the sink.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: I would kill anyone who did the things to her that she claims. He turns and walks to the other side of the kitchen, begins cleaning his hand up on a teatowel. Mulder's attention is caught by something out of shot on the opposite side of the room. He walks toward it.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's not a very Christian tenet. We see him over by a wooden door. He opens it. Ausbury doesn't notice.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: Thou -- God of Vengeance -- shine forth.

speaker: MULDER'S POV
line: LOOKING DOWN A FLIGHT OF STEPS INTO A CELLAR.

speaker: MULDER
line: Even the Devil can quote scripture to fit his needs. Ausbury turns and sees what Mulder is doing. The door slams shut by itself, startling Mulder. Ausbury doesn't seem to notice. He is furious, shouting.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: How dare you! Get out of our house! . As far as I know, you put those ideas in my daughter's head. Now get -- out! The Devil travels in many forms. And you may be one!

speaker: PADDOCK
line: Are you sure you're up to this, Shannon? I heard about what you said. Shannon is at her bench, with a fresh hog embryo on a tray in front of her. Mrs Paddock stands on the other side of the bench.

speaker: SHANNON
line: I'll be OK. I don't want to miss the final.

speaker: PADDOCK
line: I'll be in my office, if you're feeling funny. Maybe you ought to remove your jewelry. You wouldn't want to lose it in some pig's guts. I'll hold it for you until you're finished. Paddock walks back to her office. Shannon breathes deeply, steels herself for the job. Cut to her pov of the embryo on the tray. Cut to Shannon again; over her shoulder, we can see Paddock in her office, looking out. She closes the venetian blinds.

speaker: PADDOCK
line: I heard the crash, and the chair, and came running out of the office.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you see anybody leaving the room? Did you hear the door open?

speaker: PADDOCK
line: I lock the doors after school, when I'm alone. I... I get afraid.

speaker: DEBORAH
line: I feel a dark angel is amongst us. It wants a sacrifice.

speaker: VITARIS
line: It's been years since we've done that.

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: Exactly. Exactly. We haven't kept our faith.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: Are any of you... responsible... for my daughter?

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: We all are. She was sacrificed......for us. It's a portent. Shannon's death allows us to get rid of the police, the FBI... it can all be blamed on her.

speaker: DEBORAH
line: Jim. You tell them she had a thing for Jerry Stevens. She killed him out of jealousy.

speaker: VITARIS
line: She cut out his eyes, because she couldn't stand to have him look at another girl. And his heart, because she was heartbroken.

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: When they leave, and they're gone, we must rekindle our faith rather than lose it. LIGHTNING FLASHES, ILLUMINATING AUSBURY. THUNDER AS HE TURNS AND STARES AT THE OTHERS.

speaker: PADDOCK
line: I never imagined she would hurt herself like that. I'm old-fashioned, Agent Scully, I can't bring myself to believe children are capable of such things as they are these days. She wanted me to hold that for her. Mulder looks again at the bracelet, then motions silently to Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me... She puts her pen down on a bench, then walks away with Mulder. They speak quietly.

speaker: MULDER
line: Her office has a faint odour of incense. .

speaker: SCULLY
line: She says it's to block the smell of formaldehyde.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's also used in Black Mass rituals.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I've got to admit there are some oddities to her story.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean, oddities?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the man she replaced has taken two sick days in a fifteen-year career. The morning of Jerry Stevens' murder Mr Kingary developed necrotizing fasciitis.

speaker: MULDER
line: Flesh-eating bacteria? That's very rare.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know. And when I questioned the other staff members about Mrs Paddock's background, no-one can even recall hiring her. Oh, look, I'm even getting caught up in this. I mean I'm... I'm sure that Mrs Paddock's arrival and the teacher's sickness is just a coincidence. And the fact that no-one can recall hiring her -- it's just a bureaucratic oversight.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I've got a feeling this is something we both should get caught up in. I'm going to get a search warrant for the Ausbury house -- I've been told they're staying with friends. You check deeper into Mrs Paddock. MORE LIGHTNING. THIS TIME THE LIGHTS GO OUT.

speaker: COP
line: Power's out. Mrs Paddock reaches forward and grabs the pen, holding it in both hands as she watches Mulder and Scully.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: My religion, my family, Agent Mulder, goes back in this town seven generations. They fled persecution from people being persecuted, all in the name of religion. I was raised to believe Christianity was synonymous with hypocrisy. Man's natural tendency was to do as thou wilst, not do unto others. We believe... Man is nothing but an animal, no better, no worse, than those who walk on four legs. And though I believed our faith kept us powerful in the community, wealthy, good health, I... I came to see hypocrisy in the others. In me. When they told me to blame my dead daughter for Jerry Stevens' death, my reaction... I was sick that they would villify an innocent... someone I loved... just to protect themselves. And at that moment, I knew... I am better than an animal! That my... previous beliefs were responsible... for her no longer being with us. And that it was time to talk to you. MULDER NODS SYMPATHETICALLY.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Clean. 41. INT. NIGHT. PADDOCK'S OFFICE Paddock's hand over the candle. Groans, breathing, shaking, sweating as before.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you abuse Shannon?

speaker: AUSBURY
line: Never sexually.

speaker: MULDER
line: The rituals.

speaker: AUSBURY
line: . The blood of the young is considered very powerful. We'd include them in the ceremonies... against their will. They were too young to be trusted not to talk. But we never physically hurt them. We'd slip over the ancient rituals that we didn't want to do.

speaker: MULDER
line: Like... drinking grape juice instead of wine at Communion? What about Shannon's memories?

speaker: AUSBURY
line: We'd perform a sort of post-hypnotic suggestion that repressed their memories. When they came of age, eighteen, twenty- one, then they were made aware of the religion, and brought into its practice. When she recalled the past events, she must have mixed up reality with... with that crap that's on Geraldo and the tabloids.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did the others kill Jerry Stevens? Shannon?

speaker: AUSBURY
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you are responsible. You knew the possibilities contained in your beliefs, no matter how watered down. Did you really think you could call up the Devil and ask him to behave?

speaker: MULDER
line: Who are the others? Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... the school... I'm in trouble. WE HEAR A BUZZ OF STATIC, AND SHE IS CUT OFF

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? I've got an emergency. I'm placing you under arrest. I'll be back for you later. He dashes up the stairs, closes the door and bolts it. Ausbury watches him go. Mulder runs out of the front door, gets into the car and backs it out of the driveway in a tearing hurry. Ausbury, sitting on the floor next to the stairs, is crying. He is the picture of despair. The camera pans up his cuffed arm to the top of the stairs. Cut to cu of the bolt, which suddenly slides open. Mcu of the door creaking quietly open; there is nobody there. Ausbury view and starts making its way down the stairs. We follow it down, watching past Ausbury who remains unaware of it until it slides over his right shoulder and around his neck. He yells in fright and tries to shake it off, but it winds around and around his neck and body. We see him trying to pull it off, then hear him starting to choke; faint cracking sounds can be heard, implying his bones being crushed perhaps.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder! What's wrong?

speaker: MULDER
line: You called me! You said you were in trouble.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I didn't touch the phone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ausbury confessed to conspiracy. He was going to give up the names of everybody involved, parents, teachers...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I checked on Mrs Paddock's background. I don't think she's involved. Cu of Mulder's face as he pauses, cut to follow his torch as it shows the cellar door is ajar. He looks at Scully, pulls out his gun, advances carefully to the door. Mulder knocks it aside, goes downstairs. Scully follows. CELLAR, AUSBURY RESIDENCE Cu of handcuffs, still attached to the bannister but now empty. Ausbury has vanished. Mulder and Scully reach the cellar floor and shine their lights around. Mulder's light picks out a crushed and bloody skeleton, folded in on itself, about a metre away. They go over to it, both crouch down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: My God. You think that's some kind of acid? Mulder turns, shines his torch on the stair posts.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's no evidence of any reaction of the wood from the acid. There are tracks in the dirt... they're from a snake.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's impossible! It would take a large python hours to consume and weeks to digest a human being.

speaker: MULDER
line: You really do watch the Learning Channel. Scully. Snakeskin.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's a python in Paddock's room.

speaker: VITARIS
line: Sheriff Oakes called me. Jim Ausbury is dead. He was talking to the FBI.

speaker: DEBORAH
line: Did they kill him?

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: You know who killed him. Ausbury was no believer. He had no real faith, no devotion. He was punished for his doubts. We have to act. Or the same thing will happen to us. If it's not already too late.

speaker: DEBORAH
line: We have to assume Jim told them who we are.

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: If Mulder knows, it will make the offering all the more meaningful. THEY LOOK AT EACH OTHER. A FAINT MOTOR NOISE OUTSIDE IS HEARD.

speaker: DEBORAH CROSSES TO THE WINDOW AND LOOKS OUT. WE SEE HER POV
line: MULDER AND SCULLY'S CAR ARRIVING.

speaker: DEBORAH
line: They're here. Lock the office. CALCAGNI FEELS AROUND IN HIS JACKET.

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: No keys. They were in my pocket!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder. Mrs Paddock? What happened? Paddock is bleeding from the nose. Her glasses have been knocked to the floor beside her, she is clutching her abdomen. She speaks feebly and is wild-eyed.

speaker: PADDOCK
line: I... I... I came back... they were taking the snake... Miss Brown, Mr Vitaris... there are things about them I learned, I must tell you... I think they killed that boy! Mulder has his phone out and is waiting for a response

speaker: MULDER
line: We know about that.

speaker: PADDOCK
line: Conference room... it's all there! THE PHONE IS BUSY. MULDER PUTS IT AWAY AS HE SPEAKS.

speaker: MULDER
line: Paramedics must be tied up by the storm. You just stay there, Mrs Paddock. I'm going to lock the door. HE TAKES HIS FLASHLIGHT AND HURRIES OFF.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just stay still. We'll be back. She hurries after mulder. Cu on Paddock, lit by storm. She stops shaking and lies almost inanimately still. HALL OUTSIDE CONFERENCE ROOM Mulder and Scully approach the conference room door. Scully knocks it open, Mulder enters, gun at the ready. The room appears empty. Satisfied it appears safe, they both go in.

speaker: CALCAGNI
line: It'll make the blood easier to clean up. Shot of Deborah and Vitaris looking down at the agents. Deborah raises her hands to eye level. She is clasping a large, ceremonial, dagger.

speaker: DEBORAH
line: Dominus Inferus Vobisum!

speaker: CALCAGNI/VITARIS
line: Et conferum They shine their torches on Mulder and Scully. Deborah moves over to Mulder and kneels. She raises the dagger higher, preparing to strike. We hear the shotgun being cocked in the background.

speaker: DEBORAH
line: Zeine ist die hand die verletzt. Forum dubai

speaker: PADDOCK
line: You're right. It is already too late. SHE BLOWS OUT THE CANDLE.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh God... Mulder, did you see his face? It was as if something else had control of him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Paddock.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs Paddock? Mulder. Mulder goes over to her. She is at the blackboard. Mulder shines his torch where she is looking. There is writing on the board. We pan with the light along the words... "Goodbye. It's been nice working with you." Mulder and Scully look at each other. The power suddenly returns. They switch off their torches and look around the room, which is a mess, stools, racks etc knocked over, equipment smashed and broken. They turn back to the board, then back to each other.
